stories.headline: Tallying city spending on trinkets
stories.summary: Exploration into city spending on promotional items, sparked by a local history festival where Chandler, Ariz., officials distributed foam trains.

stories.headline: Records reveal ties behind charity scam
stories.summary: Investigation into how several sound-alike charities, connected to a single telemarketer, exploit donors by raising millions but spending little on actual charity.

stories.headline: Hard lessons in first big data wave
stories.summary: Analysis of the challenges and implications of the American Community Survey’s first major data release, emphasizing changes and data reliability.

stories.headline: Capitol aide's two jobs leave money trail
stories.summary: Examination of chief of staff Steven J. Ding’s financial activities and the overlap of his duties, revealing potential rule violations.

stories.headline: These sources speak when subjects won't
stories.author_title: Investigative Reporter, The New York Times
stories.summary: Guide to using public records and online databases for profiling individuals who are otherwise uncooperative.
